release.action: Introduced error codes.
New concept: composite stages.
New concept: TeeTime automatically chooses the correct type of pipe for all connections.
Added capacity to IPipe.
Added the ability to add ports to a merger at runtime.
Added the ability to add ports to a distributor at runtime.
Threads can be added at runtime.
Configurations can only be executed once.
Ports can be named for better debugging.
Stages without any input port are automatically executed in a dedicated thread.
Configurations are now built within the Configuration class. This removes any constraints on CompositeStages and enables therefore multiple connections and multithreading in such stages.
All stages will be initialized before starting the analysis.
Threads can be named for better debugging.
Exceptions within the initialization will now terminate the execution.
Added Services. Any Execution can now be aborted.
Merged Stage into AbstractStage.
Merger and Distributor strategies are moved to a separate package.
TerminatingExceptionListener is now the default listener.
Removed addThreadableStage and replaced it by AbstractStage.declareActive().
Renamed Analysis to Execution.
Removed InitializingSignal.
Removed pair class.
Solved a bug in the merger stage.
Solved a bug which led to a NullPointerExceptions.
Removed deprecated methods.
New concept: exception handling incl. Wiki tutorial.
New concept: unit test framework for testing a single stage.
New class: AbstractTransformation; Represents a stage with a single input and a single output port.
Analysis.start() is now deprecated. Use Analysis.execute() instead.
Renamed Stage.executeWithPorts() to Stage.executeStage().
Removed IterableProducer. Use InitialElementProducer instead.
Updated dependencies.
Jar is not only published via the Central Maven Repository, but also via our CI server Jenkins.
#143 Null values can block the analysis.
#109 Minor bug in ObjectProducer stage.
#75 Signal passing is incorrect.
Created a new site to promote TeeTime.
Initial release of TeeTime.
